_exec_summary.SummaryText:
ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY



The McGregor Compnay

Ritzville Chemicals

Ritzville, Washington



1. Facility Policy

The managament and employees of The McGregor Company are committed to the prevention of any accidental release of anhydrous ammonia/aqua ammonia through the use of proper equipment, regular inspections, maintenance and training of all persons that work with anhydrous ammonia/aqua ammonia. Should an accidental release occur, this facility has worked with the local fire department and local emergency planning committee so they can plan for response to a realease and minimize the impact of the release to employees, people in the surrounding area and the environment.



2. Facility Information

The primary activity at this facility is the storage, and handling of anhydrous ammonia/aqua ammonia & agricultural chemicals for sale to farmers. Anhydrous ammonia/aqua ammonia is received, stored and distributed for direct application to the soil as a crop production nutrient.



3. Worst-Case Scenario/Alternative-Case Scenario

Worst case and alternative case consequence analyses were completed for all covered processes.  The worst case scenario release assumed that all the contents in the largest vessel were released.  For Anhydrous ammonia, the release was modeled as if the ammonia tank was punctured on the side at the ground level and the resulting release being a ground level horizontal jet.  For the aqua ammonia, the release was modeled as if the stationary storage tank failed and instantaneously spilling the content within the diked containment and the resulting release being evaporated at the maximum temperature.



Alternative (or more likely to occur) scenario assumes rupture of a transfer hose during a major loading or unloading operation.  Although this event is classified as an alternative scenario, even an accident of this type is unlikely to occur due to the safety equipment(excess flow devices, emergency shutoff valv

es, and check valves) and operating procedures that TMC uses to safeguard ammonia transfer operations.



4. Accidental Release Program

This facility complies with various rules and regulations govering the storage and handling of anhydrous ammonia/aqua ammonia including ANSI K61.1, OSHA 29 CFR 1910.111 and regulations administered by our state agency. Training is provided on safe anhydrous ammonia/aqua ammonia operations for employees.



5. Five-Year Accident History

There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia/aqua ammonia for this covered process at this facility in the past five years.



6. The Emergency Response Program

The facility has a written emergency plan in accordance with OSHA standards 29 CFR 1910.38 and 29 CFR 1910.120. Emergency planning and community right-to-know information is provided to state emergency response commission, local emergency planning committee and local fire department as required by SARA Title III of EPCRA.



7. Planned Changed to Improve Safety

Safety improvement is an on-going process at this facility. Periodic inspections and evaluations are performed to assess the maintenance of safe practices and operations. There are no additional specific anhydrous ammonia/aqua ammonia safety recommendations for implementation at this time.
